annotation.TEXT: It's kind of strange how my least favorite level in the whole game is immediately followed up by my absolute favorite one. This stage has arguably more cheap-shots than the last (especially in the case of one particular skeleton), but beyond that, I can't bring myself to hate this place. Everything about it - from the looks, to the music - is pretty neat. I don't even mind those silly, out-of-place looking ghosts (especially given the goofy skeletons earlier).

The skeleton at the end of this crumbling platform section is easily one of the nastiest cases of enemy placement in the game. Even if you know he's there, chances are pretty high that he's going to jump into you and send you flying off the edge the moment you reach the end.
With that out of the way however, it's actually pretty smooth sailing from here on out. The rest of the stage is mostly just jumping challenges combined with the occasional ring for you to swing on.

The boss of this stage actually isn't as bad as it seems, or at least, as it apparently looks when I face it (this is one of those runs where the stage went really well, but the boss itself...not so much). To note however, this is definitely one of the few bosses in the game where the cross isn't as useful (the Axe is a much better choice for this fight).

Beyond that, I should also note that this is probably my least favorite stage in the entire game (yes, even more-so than the Clock Tower or Stage B). The numerous death-trap hazards are one thing, but this is also where the game starts to amp up the number of cheap shots via enemy placement (a good example is a situation in a section up ahead: where an eye creature spawns above you while on a small platform - while at the same time a bone pillar sits just out of reach, ready to pelt you with fireballs).

Time for a bit of self-correcting here: I was actually wrong about the whole acid drops in Stage 3. Somehow I got that reported change mixed up with an actual change present in this stage: The International version of this game has drops/pools of acid (as seen here), but in the Japanese version, it's actually blood.

That goofy looking skeleton on the right has probably hit me on the way down more times than I'd like to admit. Aside from that, this area also has a new gimmick that I don't think ever shows up again: unstable areas of stairs that break apart if you hit them (the debris that result from it can also hurt you).

This recolored dog is actually kind of an interesting enemy. It moves slower than the dogs from the castle entrance, but it can leap up and take out candles, thereby robbing you of potential goodies. I think it actually makes for a pretty neat enemy concept...which is a bit of a shame, considering it only shows up a grand total of two times in the whole game (both of which are in this stage).

I don't really have much to say about the...mutant centipede? Resorting to the CV Wiki again, apparently it's called a Larva (or "Undead Parasite" in other sources). Either way, while it's possible to kill this thing, it's not really worth the effort to do so (the only thing you get for beating it is points).
Why would anyone even bother to get this >
